column4: leave it to exchange to make my transition to linux a serious pain in my ass.
yeah I know, I have to use the damn thing at work, it is horrible
yep, not against Exchange though, via POP3
ah, my issue is with how evolution handles public folders on exchange servers
evolution seems to only want to show me the top level of any folder
Get the users to migrate to SharePoint :-p
haha, I wish, it's a major university
I tried joining #evolution, and that was kind of fruitless
I work at a major corporate in Oz, and we used to have Lotus Notes. Very nice, ran on Solaris and Windoze. Then we "upgraded" to Exchange/Outlook. What a mess.
We now run something like 10 Xeon blades for the Exchange servers when a single RedHat blade could have handled it running Notes
haha, yeah, I've seen the networking diagrams for my work for the exchange servers, it's mind boggling just how many machines they need just for storage.
know of any other freenode channels that are good for general linux support?
not really sorry. I am just popping past.... but I recall some open source groupware that interfaces to Exchange and then you can use IMAP on top of that ... could you do that?
nah, I need a specific exchange feature, which is their public folders. I've got email and calendar working just fine.
